source: IRS Section 48E / Clean Electricity Investment Credit
notes: Section 48E replaces Section 48 for projects placed in service after Dec 31, 2024

without_pwa.description: Base rate without prevailing wage and apprenticeship requirements

with_pwa.description: Base rate with prevailing wage and apprenticeship requirements

domestic_content.description: Domestic content bonus for steel, iron, and manufactured products
requirements: Steel and iron manufactured in the US
Manufactured products meet domestic content percentage
40% domestic content for construction starting before June 16, 2025

energy_community.description: Energy community bonus for qualifying locations

categories.name: coal_closure
categories.description: Census tracts with coal mines closed after 1999 or coal plants retired after 2009

categories.name: statistical_area
categories.description: MSAs/non-MSAs with >= 0.17% fossil fuel employment and above-average unemployment

categories.name: brownfield
categories.description: Sites with hazardous substance contamination per EPA

tier_1.description: Located in low-income community or on Indian land

tier_2.description: Affordable housing development or direct low-income benefit

pwa_exception.description: Projects under 1 MW qualify for full 30% without PWA requirements

phase_down_notes: Phase-out starts for later of 2032 or when US GHG emissions from electricity are 25% of 2022 levels

energy_storage.notes: Energy storage technology qualifies for Section 48E ITC for projects placed in service after Dec 31, 2024
